result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Deon Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit given for 3 days time served if revoked.
Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes:
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No contact with the victim.
No contact with the co-actor.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until 07-24-2015 at 12:00 PM.  The first 90 days are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 9 months, Court allows release privileges for employment, school, or treatment purposes only.  Court ordered GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT to apply towards the condition time.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
Cancellation Of Huber / Work Release / Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant To Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03.(4).

Letter to Annette Baskin.
Letter from Annette Baskin.
Dosage Probation Approved.

Defendant Andre Deon Moore in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's stepmother, Carolyn W., and defendant's cousin, Anton S.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS. 
Credit given for 3 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" at the House of Correction - STAYED until 07-24-2015 at 12:00 PM.  The first 90 days are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 9 months, Court allows release privileges for employment, school, or treatment purposes only.  Court ordered GOOD TIME RELEASE CREDIT to apply towards the condition time.
* No contact with the victim.
* No contact with the co-actor.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Sentencing Referral Form.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
4 Photos.

Defendant Andre Deon Moore in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
SENTENCING MEMORANDUM; filed.
(9) Defendant's Character Witness Letters; filed.

Defendant Andre Deon Moore in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Ron Dague for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the defendant attend school- no absences, and obey all rules in his parent's household.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kyle S., Alonso L.S., Mayfair Mall.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
